text:
Michael Joseph Anderson, Sr. (30 January 1920 – 25 April 2018) was a British movie director. He was best known for directing "The Dam Busters" (1955), "Around the World in 80 Days" (1956) and "Logan's Run" (1976). He was the step-grandfather of Laurie Holden.
Anderson died at his home in Vancouver, British Columbia on 25 April 2018 at the age of 98.
